roleset.name: find (out)

role.descr: attribute on arg1 (found out to be/as what)

example.name: discover-v: discover an NP
example.text: Intel said that last week a customer discovered two flaws in its 80486 microprocessor chip's ``floating-point unit'', a set of circuits that do certain calculations.
example.arg: two flaws in its 80486 microprocessor chip's ``floating-point unit'', a set of circuits that do certain calculations.

example.name: discover-v: discover an SBAR
example.text: But when they discover that markets aren't always as liquid as they supposed -- markets jump.
example.arg: that markets aren't always as liquid as they supposed

example.name: discover-v: with benefactive
example.text: John discovered for Mary the set of books that he'd borrowed from her years earlier.
example.arg: the set of books that he'd borrowed from her years earlier.

example.name: ARG1 and ARG3
example.text: The air - waybill number was changed en route , and paper work showing that the crates had cleared customs was misplaced , so it was a week before three of the four crates could be located in a bonded warehouse and the Gauguin discovered missing .

example.name: discovered-j
example.text: There is no new background or new development that [*] is newly discovered or different from what the public experienced in the past .

example.name: discovery-n: Arg 1 in PP
example.text: the discovery of suspect chemical weapons material at an agricultural complex in central Iraq
example.arg: at an agricultural complex in central Iraq

roleset.note: DISCOVER-V NOTES: Based on financial subcorpus; adjectival 'discovered' based on BOLT-7. Comparison with find (out). Member of VNcls discover-84, conjecture-29.5-2, sight-30.2. (from discover.01-v)
DISCOVERY-N NOTES: Based on nouns-00080. Comparison to 'discover'. See Vn classes conjecture-29.5-1, discover-84, and sight-30.2. Framed by Katie. (from discovery.01-n)
DISCOVERED-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from discovered.01-j)
